instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
Hi,
this board receive liquid, not work. the USB C connector JB5000 is burn, i remove it and the board start and work well on the other USBC port. but if i unplug the board, the mac work well above 60% of battery.
when the battery is low, I have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 11V, is it normal? with power supply 13,05V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
If only battery connected, you cannot exepect to get 13V.
You will get the voltage according with battery level.
Even if battery and charger are connected at same time, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is lower and increases charging the battery.
When battery is fully charged, you will get 13V steady voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message: ok i understand but what can i check to look why the board make kernel panic when the level battery come under 60%.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
Try known good working battery first.
I saw so many weird problems generated by batteries, as you cannot imagine...
I don't refer to this model, but in general.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
i test with an another original battery of another macbook pro same year.
I have a kernel panic when i run heaven on battery (the level of battery is not important) i have the problem at 75%.
When i run heaven in power supply no problem. when the problem come, the screen become black and i have the text of kernel panic after 10 seconds.
Do you have any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
Graphics benchmark requires lot of power.
Battery should be capable to support that, but in time may fail probably.
You can run same test in similar machine, for comparison.

Machine works good, apart of benchmark fail?
No problems on battery in normal mode?
I don't think someone will play hard games on battery only...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
no the mac don't work well on battery, make kernel panic when you use it on battery.
I use heaven to stress more quickly the mac for make the problem.
heaven work well on other mac on battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot intermittent when battery under 60%
threads.message:
Install HWMonitor and check for strange current, or temp value.
Check the traces and components related with BMON signal.
